metadata.author: Jonathan Mathieu
schema_policy: Keep mean/std fields for scoring interoperability.
Priors are provided as a justification layer; mean/std are derived from priors by deterministic rules below.

definition.R1: principal-axis rotation but measurably excited (non-synchronous), no clear NPA signature

gravity_coefficients.convention: dimensionless harmonics; mapping to Hera convention is locked in CONVENTIONS.md

rationale: Post-DART analyses predict persistent NPA state at Hera arrival; hence R2 dominates.
Non-zero probability reserved for rapid damping or geometry-driven ambiguity.

deterministic_derivation_rule: C22_mean/std and J2_mean/std are set to conservative moments approximations under the above priors, truncated to hard_bounds.
If Hera provides C20 instead of J2, conversion is applied per CONVENTIONS.md before scoring.

mc_settings.notes: Used only to map priors -> mean/std deterministically; mean/std fields remain the interoperable inputs for scoring.

deterministic_derivation_rule: decay_exponent_mean/std computed from uniform bounds (mean=(a+b)/2, std=(b-a)/sqrt(12)).
timescale_mean/std approximated from truncated lognormal by Monte Carlo with fixed seed and fixed n_samples in mc_settings.

implementation_notes: Continuous scoring uses mean/std fields for interoperability. If priors exist, the scorer may optionally sample to compute CRPS consistently, using mc_settings where provided (fixed seed, fixed n_samples).
Rotation regime scoring uses the categorical log score on (R0,R1,R2).
